posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked:
We’re releasing the Signal 7.38 beta soon. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

★ No new notes! Lots of small UI fixes with help from the community :)

Complete list of new commits since 7.37.3:
https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.37.3…main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

New Version: 7.38.0 (152300)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

52 new commits since 7.37.3:

Show commits

  • Update to the latest Backup.proto [1]

  • Use the new avatar color hash algorithm. [2]

  • Fix story list clipping at bottom [3]

    Removes unnecessary padding at the bottom of the stories landing fragment RecyclerView.

  • Separate and kotlinize websockets. [4]

  • Add support for avatar colors in storage service. [5]

  • Remove libsignal shadow/bridge websocket infra. [6]

  • Support scheduled voice notes. [7]

    Resolves #13957

  • Fix scheduled voice note playback. [8]

    Resolves #13951

  • Add accessibility labels for media preview and emojis. [9]

    Fixes #14034
    Resolves #14037

  • Fix DozeBanner dismissal and button tint. [10]

    Resolves #14001

  • Improve trimming of leading zeros in E164 formatting. [11]

  • Block avatar downloads in message request states. [12]

  • Convert device linking apis to use websockets. [13]

  • Fix checks in backup subscription check job. [14]

  • Fix bounded-io thread pool race condition preventing additional thread starts. [15]

  • Revert "Fix some media not appearing in the gallery picker." [16]

  • Cap the max image render size to 12000x12000. [17]

  • Prevent empty passphrases when restoring local chat backups. [18]

    Fixes #14015
    Resolves #14016

  • Add the ability to edit a link preview in stories before sending. [19]

    Resolves #14035

  • Improve logging output. [20]

  • Update various message request UI. [21]

  • Add migration to clean up dupe e164's (again). [22]

  • Take purchase token straight from payment result during linking to subscriber id. [23]

  • Convert all account based calls to WebSocket. [24]

  • Convert chat-based backup calls to WebSocket. [25]

  • Mark end state in job that failed with an error. [26]

  • Trigger backup-id upload before allowing user to pay. [27]

  • Resolve consistent subscription state after new subscription is created. [28]

  • Improve handling of errors when saving media attachments. [29]

    Improves the error handling in SaveAttachmentUtil.saveAttachments() to continue processing all requested attachment saves even after individual save operations fail.

  • Do not notify call observers if data has not changed. [30]

  • Add ability to delete avatars in internal details. [31]

  • Remove unusued NetworkFailureException. [32]

  • Improve network reliability. [33]

  • Post internal notification for failed archive media restores. [34]

  • Fix label of field in internal settings. [35]

  • Update linked devices check. [36]

  • Convert calling and payments apis to WebSocket. [37]

  • Convert CDSI auth to WebSocket and service to NetworkResult. [38]

  • Convert storage service auth to WebSocket. [39]

  • Convert rate limit apis to WebSocket. [40]

  • Remove dead code from PushServiceSocket. [41]

  • Remove WebSocket to REST fallback for attachments. [42]

  • Fix recurring donations unit tests. [43]

  • Add headers to StatusCodeError. [44]

  • Update to libsignal v0.67.4 [45]

  • Add support for blocked chat events. [46]

  • Start new style messsage api and convert report spam to WebSocket. [47]

  • Consistently format byte sizes. [48]

  • Add internal debug setting to archive session. [49]

  • Revert delete account conversion to WebSocket. [50]

  • Update translations and other static files. [51]

  • Bump version to 7.38.0 [52]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.37.3…v7.38.0

Localization changes

Note: after clicking a link, it may take a few seconds before GitHub jumps to the file (try scrolling a bit if it doesn’t).

posts.name: Oleh Hrekov
posts.cooked: The program doesn’t work. It crashes.

posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked: Could you explain what you mean here? Also if you could provide a debug log, that would be great.
Link to previous beta: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.37 release - #40 by najodleglejszy

posts.name: Voltaine
posts.cooked:
Directly crashes upon oppening for me as well on Android 14.
Uploaded the logcat in my Google Drive and sent you the link in a direct message @mtang-signal

posts.name: Michelle
posts.cooked: Hey all! We’re aware of an issue for some users on 7.38.0 where it crashes on startup (result of a bad migration). We should have a fix out very soon if people want to wait for 7.38.1.

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked:
I’m guessing, tomorrow? No shade, just want to know if I’ll be able to use it later today

Edit: I was able to open the app by tapping on a notification (regular one, not a chat bubble)

Edit #2: but it’s stuck on a weird state where I can read messages but not Download Attachments, and I cannot send messages

posts.cooked: No crashing on 7.38.1.

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked: Can confirm, thanks @mtang-signal !

posts.name: Oleh Hrekov
posts.cooked:
repaired. Thank you.

It stopped crashing because it was updated.

posts.name: Hugo
posts.cooked: This is beyond the scope of testing, but I’m curious @mtang-signal, why were so many calls migrated to WebSockets?

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.37 release Android Beta Feedback
For those encountering the no longer have a badge/subscription gone issues, the server team is aware and fixed the cause to prevent others, but will need more time about any potential remedies for those already impacted. Sorry, another follow up: Any of them edited or special in any way? Looks like a video data issue, do you know which platform the video was sent from and if the sender can view the video fine? Sorry to ask, but do you have the log and time of the second call that you can c…

@cody-signal , no, the ones out of order weren’t edited or anything at all.

link_counts.title: Get the latest Android releases even faster with Firebase App Distribution

posts.cooked:
After Signal accidentally canceled my donation subscription I renewed it (SEPA).
Still no badge in my profile after several days, but the banned asked me for a donation.

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.38.2/0092a308c8cec1a0782832ed295fae15250b1191bf5d7ff0d07e8942419e2732

If there is a delay due to SEPA okay, but I’d suggest to show the badge directly and remove if the transaction is not successful.
Of course the banner should not appear.

posts.name: Alex Hart
posts.cooked:
Leibi:

After Signal accidentally canceled my donation subscription I renewed it (SEPA).
Still no badge in my profile after several days, but the banned asked me for a donation.

This appears to be an error with how websocket connections are handled in 7.38 and we will put a solution in a dot release during this beta.

Leibi:

If there is a delay due to SEPA okay, but I’d suggest to show the badge directly and remove if the transaction is not successful.

We could do that locally but the badge is an entitlement on your account and completely separate from your payment.

Leibi:

Of course the banner should not appear.

I’ll bring this up with design, whereas if there is a pending subscription we likely shouldn’t show the banner.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
Not sure what platform is at fault, but I was added to a blocked group on Desktop. I was actually part of it and was capable of updating the group with a leave. Thought the primary should be able to handle this.

https://debuglogs.org/desktop/7.46.0/23faa15b62f978b46b8c18ee23ac111e69654430f835abdaa40fe95695e2a1a0.gz

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.38.2/3ebe18505a5a4953113a9ad88688d5f20f13b7bbf0481fe20ad7b19e566fbaf8

New Version: 7.38.3 (152600)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

7 new commits since 7.38.2:

  • Improve stacktraces by not wrapping CDS exceptions in RuntimeExceptions. [1]

  • Improve error code handling in recurring context job. [2]

  • Add checks for user registration when attempting to access dontations or perform keep-alive. [3]

  • Suppress megaphone if user is not registered. [4]

  • Update translations and other static files. [5]

  • Update baseline profile. [6]

  • Bump version to 7.38.3 [7]
